Name: tian hua fen
天花粉
gua lou gen
Other name: tian hua fen originally was called gua lou gen

Geography: throughout China, especially in Shandong, Hebei, Shanxi, Shaanxi
Properties: root: sweet, slightly bitter, slightly cold
gua lou pi (pericardium trichosanthis): caramel-like smell, bland, slightly sour
Maladies Treated: Lung heat, dissolves phlegm: for cough with thick phlegm
Hydatidiform mole (hydatidiform tumor, trophoblastic disease, gestational trophoblastic neoplasia)
Heat disease vexation thirst (热病烦渴)
Lung heat dry cough (肺热燥咳)
Internal heat wasting thirst (内热消渴)
Ulcer swelling and toxicity (疮痈肿毒)
Anti-ulcer effect: reduces ulcers caused by acid
Medical Function: Clears lung heat, dissolves phlegm
Expels pus
Rid of toxicity
Trichosanthes can increase coronary blood flow

Injection of trichosanthes bark (gua lou pi) decoction and alcohol precipitation concentrates on in vitro guinea pig hearts can expand coronary artery and can empower coronary blood flow by about 60% on acute myocardial ischemia and can have a significant protective effect. The strength of coronary artery expansion effect of the different parts of the herb is: Trichosanthes skin (gua lou pi) > gua lou xiang > Trichosanthes sub > Trichosanthes Ren > Trichosanthes shell
Tian hua fen has antiarrhythmic effects
Tian hua fen can inhibit cardiac function
Tian hua fen can significantly reduce heart rate, left ventricular pressure peak, dp/dtmax, Rdp/dtmaxVmax and Vpm indicators, but also significantly reduce arterial pressure peak, DPB and MAP
Tian hua fen has expectorant effect. The active ingredient is the total amino acids of the skin of the fruit
Tian hua fen has purgative effect: the intensity is Trichosanthes Ren > Trichosanthes skin > Tian hua fen cream
Possesses anticancer effects
Possesses hypoxia tolerance
Tian hua fen inhibits platelet aggregation, and its active ingredient is tian hua fen acids
Tian hua fen can significantly reduce the hematocrit and blood viscosity
Tian hua fen can elevate blood sugar
Tian hua fen can inhibit intestinal contractions
Tian hua fen possesses antibacterial effect on a variety of bacteria, including cocci, bacilli, and Audubon Ang's small spores rubrum (奥杜盎氏小芽孢癬菌)
Anti HIV effect
Tian hua fen can significantly reduce gastric acid secretion and gastric acid concentration, and have anti-ulcer effect, but also reduce ulcers caused by acid

Tian hua fen effects on macrophages: administered at low concentrations, enhances the role of macrophages, but at high concentrations of short duration also show enhancing effect, however for a long duration (72 hours) can cause damage to the macrophages
Tian hua fen has anti-aging effect
Tian hua fen possesses the effects of abortion and inducing delivery
In large dosage and prolonged administration it can inhibit the immune system
Inhibits protein synthesis
Samples of Formulae:
chai hu gui zhi gan jiang tang (柴胡桂枝乾薑湯)
San Zhong Kui Jian Tang (散腫潰堅湯)

For hydatidiform tumor: Tian zao combination formula: tian hua fen (天花粉) 60 mg, ya zao jiao (椰枣胶) 25 mg ground into fine powder and put into capsules. Insert into vagina once every 5 to 7 days. Treated 7 patients: among those who had hydatidiform tumors (5 patients) all healed. Two patients with chorion-epithelioma had no effect. Using tian zao combination formula and chemotherapy: in 19 patients, 13 healed, 6 ineffective. Using tian zao combination formula and chemotherapy plus surgery: in 65 patients, 54 healed, 11 ineffective.
Contraindications:
Not to be used by pregnant women or in cases of pixu (spleen deficiency) or weixu (stomach deficiency).
Large dosages and/or long-term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
Research:
Tian hua fen possesses anti-cancer effect.
Tian hua fen has anti-HIV effect.
Trichosanthin is being used clinically in inducing delivery and it possesses effects of anti-hydatidiform tumor (葡萄胎) and anti-HIV.
Karasurin possesses the effects of abortion and inducing delivery in pregnant laboratory mice. It also inhibits the immune system.
Modern application: For hydatidiform tumor: see Samples of Formulae for detailed study results (7 patients: 5 healed, 2 not effective; combination with chemotherapy: 13/19 healed; combination with chemo and surgery: 54/65 healed). [4]
Notes:
Source (Chinese): Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本，Zhong Yao Da Zhi Dian 中藥大辭典.
Hydatidiform tumor alternative names: hydatidiform mole, trophoblastic disease, gestational trophoblastic neoplasia.
Definition: A hydatidiform tumor occurs when a fetus is not able to fully form in the uterus and the fetal tissue becomes a tumor.
Chemical Ingredients: Protein: Trichosanthin (天花粉蛋白) with molecule weight of 24,000, isoelectric point 9.4, a simple protein without phosphorous acid groups. Used clinically in inducing delivery. Possesses anti-hydatidiform tumor and anti-HIV effects.
Karasurin (堕胎蛋白), molecule weight 28,000, possesses effects of abortion and inducing delivery in pregnant laboratory mice. Inhibits immune system.
α-momorcharin (α-苦瓜素), molecule weight 29,000 and β-momorcharin, molecule weight 28,000, with 1.6% and 1.3% neutral sugar, contain asparagic acid and glutamic acid, no cysteine.

Polysaccharides: consist of glucose, fructose, galactose (cerebrose), mannose, xylose, and small amount of protein. Source of calories. Improves the immune system. Possesses anti-cancer and toxic activities from the cells.
Newly isolated: 1-deoxy-1-[2'-oxo-1'-pyrrolidinyl]-2-n-butyl-α-fructofuranoside and isoarvenin III (異海綠甾苷)
Original Text:
tian hua fen

Name: qing hao
Chinese: 滨蒿 (Artemisia Scoparia Waldst. Et Kitaib.)

Maladies Treated: for flu with fever and chills, sweating, heaviness in the head, tired, fullness in the chest (in combination in formulae)
malaria and warm illness with fever in the evening and cool in the morning, thirst, wanting to drink water (in combination in formulae)
gu zheng lao re: fatigue, flushed cheeks, night sweats, and progressive emaciation (in combination in formulae)
Medical Function: anti-malaria
the essential oil of qing hao is effective for chronic bronchitis
qinghaosu can elevate the calcium ions of leukemia white cells, thus induces the diseased white cell to change and die
Dosage: 3 to 12 g. If heat is high, the dosage can be up to 24 g. Do not boil for long time.
Samples of Formulae:
For flu with fever and chills, sweating, heaviness in the head, tired, fullness in the chest. 
Name of formula: huang qin qing dan tang. Composition: qing hao (Artemisia annua), huang qin (Scutellaria, Baikal skullcap root), ban xia (Pinellia tuber), chen pi (Aged tangerine peel), jie ke (Bitter orange), zhu ru (Bamboo shavings), fu ling (Poria), bi yi san (Bi yi powder).

For malaria and warm illness with fever in the evening and cool in the morning, thirst, wanting to drink water. 
Name of formula: qing hao bie jia tang. Composition: qing hao (Artemisia annua), bie jia (Turtle shell), zhi mu (Anemarrhena asphodeloides), sheng di huang (Rehmannia root), dan pi (Moutan bark).

For gu zheng lao re: fatigue, flushed cheeks, night sweats, and progressive emaciation.
Name of formula: qing gu san. Composition: qing hao (Artemisia annua), di gu pi (Lycium bark), yin chai hu (Stellaria root), hu huang lian (Picrorhiza rhizome), qin jiu (Gentiana macrophylla), bie jia (Turtle shell), zhi mu (Anemarrhena asphodeloides), gan cao (Licorice).

蒿芩清膽湯《通俗傷寒論》(Huang qin qing dan tang according to 'Popular Treatise on Cold Damage'): qing hao (Artemisia annua), huang qin (Baikal skullcap root), ban xia (Pinellia tuber), chen pi (Aged tangerine peel), zhi ke (Bitter orange), zhu ru (Bamboo shavings), fu ling (Poria), bi yu san (Bi yu powder). For external contracted damp heat, unresolved fever with mild chills, sweating unresolved, heaviness of the head and tired limbs, chest tightness and fullness.
Contraindications:
Not to use in post partum women with blood deficiency or cold from pixu (spleen deficiency with cold in the stomach).
反當歸 (incompatible with Dang Gui, Angelica sinensis root), 生地黃 (Rehmannia root, raw, is incompatible).
Side effect of decoction or pill forms: only a small number of patients showed nausea, vomiting, diarrhea or stomach ache. Most patients did not show any side effect. A small number of patients showed skin allergy. No abnormal liver, kidney, or ECG findings observed.
Research: See qing hao su for malaria treatment.
Notes: Only the young leaves are effective.
Chemical Ingredients: 青蒿酸甲酯 (Qinghao acid methyl ester)

volatile oil contains: 蒿酮 (Artemisia ketone), 異蒿醇 (Iso-artemisia ketone), 桉葉素 (Cineole), 左旋樟脑 (l-Camphor), β-石竹烯 (β-Caryophyllene), 反式-石竹烯 (trans-Caryophyllene), α,β-蒎烯 (α,β-pinene), 莰烯 (Camphene), 月桂烯 (Myrcene), 檸檬烯 (Limonene), γ-松油烯 (γ-Terpinene), α-松油醇 (α-Terpineol), 反式-β-金合欢烯 (trans-β-Farnesene), α,β,γ-榄香烯 (α,β,γ-Elemene), γ,δ-毕橙茄烯 (γ,δ-Cadinene), 顺式-香苇醇 (cis-Carveol), 古吧烯 (Copaene), β-馬啊里烯 (β-Maalinene), γ-衣兰油烯 (γ-Muurolene), 乙酸龙脑脂 (Bornyl acetate), 異戊酸龙脑酯 (Bornyl isovalerate)

Do not boil for long time.3 ~ 12克。熱盛者﹐可用至24克。不耐久煎。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕For flu with fever and chills, sweating, heaviness in the head, tired, fullness in the chest.Name of formula: huang qin qing dan tangComposition: qing hao, huang qin, ban xia, chen pi, jie ke, zhu ru, fu ling, bi yi san. For malaria and warm illness with fever in the evening and cool in the morning, thirty, wanting to drink water.Name of formula: qing hao bie jia tangComposition: qing hao, bie jia, zhi mu, sheng di huang, dan pi. For gu zheng lao re: fatigue, flushed cheeks, night sweats, and progressive emaciation.Name of formula:  qing gu sanComposition:  qing hao, di gu pi, yin chai hu, hu huang lian, qin jiu, bie jia, zhi mu, gan cao. 蒿芩清膽湯《通俗傷寒論》：青蒿，黃芩，半夏 ，陳皮，枳殼，竹茹，茯苓，碧玉散。治外感濕熱之邪，留戀不解 ，微惡寒而發熱，有汗不解 ，頭重肢倦，胸悶痞滿等症。 青蒿鱉甲湯《溫病條辨》：青蒿，鱉甲，知母，生地， 丹皮。治瘧疾及溫病之暮熱早涼汗解渴飲者。 清骨散《證治準繩》：青蒿，地骨皮，銀柴胡， 胡黃連，秦艽，鱉甲，知母，甘草。治骨蒸勞熱。Modern Research:現代研究﹕See qing hao su for malaria treatment.Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Not to use in post partum women with blood deficient  or cold from  pixu (spleen deficient with cold in the stomach.The side effect of decoction or pill forms: only a small number of patients showed nausea, vomiting, diarrhea or stomach ache. Name: ba jiao hui xiang
八角茴香
Other name: wu xiang ba jiao 五香八角
po shang hui xiang 舶上茴香
hui xiang ba jiao zhu 茴香八角珠
ba jiao da hui 八角大茴
Pronunciation in Cantonese: baat3 gok3 wui4 hoeng1 (八角茴香)

Geography: Guangdong, Yunnan, Guizhou, Hunan, Taiwan provinces of China, southeast Asia, India
Maladies Treated: chronic lower back pain with shenxu (kidney deficient)
vomiting due to coldness in stomach
swelling of testes, pain cannot be tolerated
hernia: xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) with ba jiao hui xiang (star anise) and ru xiang (frankincense)
hernia: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise), xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) with ru xiang (frankincense)
hernia: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise) and xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit), powder form, used with pig's urinary bladder, boiled in wine, for hernia with testicle drooping (偏墜)
lower back heaviness and stabbing distention
lower back pain like stabbing: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise, fried and pounded), internal with salted soup, external with hot sticky rice bag on painful spot
constipation of both urination and defecation, abdominal fullness and distention like a drum, dyspnea
wind toxin dampness with ulcers, purple skin, pus and rotting of flesh, weakness of limbs, skin redness and heat
Medical Function: strong inhibition effect on Staphylococcus aureus, Corynebacterium diphtheriae, Bacillus Subtilis, Vibro cholerae, Salmonella typhi, Shigella dysenteriae, Escherichia coli, and common pathogenic skin fungi (ethanol extract of ba jiao hui xiang)
clears wind-cold, regulates qi and stops pain (温阳散寒，理气止痛)
induce sweating when taken hot in tea (as described in formula for hernia)
warming yang and dispelling cold, regulating qi, stopping pain
Samples of Formulae:
1. For hernia: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise), xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) 9 g each, ru xiang (frankincense) small amount. Boil with water. Use as tea. Cover the body to induce sweating.

2. Li zhi san (from 'Zheng Zhi Zhun Sheng') for hernia, swelling of testes, unbearable pain. Composition: li zhi he (lychee kernel, fresh, bake till dark) 14 pieces, ba jiao hui xiang (star anise, stir fry), chen xiang (aloeswood), mu xiang (costus root), qing yan (coarse lake salt), table salt 3 g each, chuan lian zi (toosendan fruit), xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) 6 each. Take 9 g each time, mix with warm rice wine on an empty stomach.

3. Hernia with testicle prolapse: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise), xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) 3 qian (about 11.25g) each, ru xiang (frankincense) small amount. Decoction for sweating. (Renzhai Zhizhi Fang)

4. Hernia with one-sided prolapse: powder of ba jiao hui xiang (star anise) and xiao hui xiang (fennel fruit) 1 liang (about 37.5g) each. Place both powders inside a pig's bladder, add the urine, tie and cook with wine until rotten, pound into balls size of wutong seeds. Take 50 pills per dose, with plain soup. (Weisheng Zaxing)

5. Heaviness and stabbing pain/distention of lower back: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise), fried and powdered, take before meals with wine, 2 qian (about 7.5g). (Renzhai Zhizhi Fang)

6. Lower back pain like stabbing: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise, fried and powdered), take 2 qian (about 7.5g) before meals with salted soup. Externally, use 1–2 sheng of glutinous rice, fried hot, bagged, tied to the affected area. (Jianbian Danfang)

7. Constipation of urination and defecation, abdominal distension: da ma zi (hemp seed, fried and shelled) 1/2 liang (~18.75g), ba jiao hui xiang (star anise) 7 pieces, mash with 3–7 scallion whites, decoct, and mix with wu ling san powder for administration. (Yong Lei Qian Fang)

8. Wind-toxin dampness with ulcers, purple/rotten skin, weakness, and heat: ba jiao hui xiang (star anise, fried), di long (earthworm, fried and cleaned), chuan wu (aconite root, prepared and peeled), wu yao (lindera root, sliced), qian niu zi (morning glory seed, fried), each 1 liang (~37.5g). Grind, use wine paste to form balls size of wutong seeds. Take 15 pills on empty stomach with salted soup, twice daily. (Jiaoqi Zhifa Zongyao, Hui Xiang Wan)
Contraindications:
Use with care in cases of yin deficiency with heat.

Sometimes Chinese star anise (Illicium verum) is adulterated with Japanese star anise (Illicium anisatum L) which is toxic and may cause acute-onset irritability, jitteriness, clonus or myoclonus, increased deep tendon reflexes, nystagmus, vomiting, and seizures, especially in infants. Do not use star anise in infants.
Research:
Ethanol extract of ba jiao hui xiang (star anise) demonstrated strong inhibitory effects against Staphylococcus aureus, Pneumococcus, Corynebacterium diphtheriae, Bacillus subtilis, Vibrio cholerae, Salmonella typhi, Paratyphoid bacteria, Shigella dysenteriae, Escherichia coli, and common pathogenic skin fungi.

One study reported that safrole was not found in Illicium verum but was detected in all toxic Illicium species, but not in Illicium verum. [2]
Notes: Source: partially obtained from 'Whole National Herb Edition' (《全國中草藥匯編》)。

Chemical Ingredients: seeds contain 4–9% evaporating oil (about 5% in general; more in skin of seeds)
small amount of safrole (see research regarding safrole absence in Illicium verum)
leaves contain evaporating oil including anethole and anisaldehyde

In general it contains about 5% and more of it in the skin of the seeds. The main evaporating oil is anethole (about 80 to 90%). Usually it separates itself when it is cold. The remainder are d-pinene, I--phellandrene, α-terpineol and small amount of safrole*, methyl chavicol.fat about 22% (mainly in seed)protein, resin, rubber etc.leaves contain: evaporating oil which consists of anethole, anisaldehyde etc.*In one study, it mentioned the safrole was not found in Illicium verum but found in all toxic Illicium species, but not in Illicium verum.[2]果實含揮發油4～9％，一般約為5％(果皮中較多)，脂肪油約22％(主存於種子中)及蛋白質，樹膠，樹脂等。揮發油中主要成份為茴香醚(anethole) 約80～90％，冷時常自油中析出，其餘為d-蒎烯 (d-pinene)，l- 水芹烯  (I--phellandrene) ，α-萜品醇  (α-terpineol)及 少量黃樟醚 (safrole)** ，甲基胡椒酚(methyl chavicol)。葉含揮發油，油中含茴香醚 (anethole)，茴香醛  (anisaldehyde)等**有研究报告說本品(Illicium verum)不含黃樟醚 (safrole)，但其他有毒的品種則含黃樟醚 [2]。Dosage:用 量﹕ 3～6g,3~6 克。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕1. Hernia: ba jiao hui xiang, xiao hui xiang 9 g each, ru xiang small amount. Boil with water. Use as tea. Mix with warm rice wine and take with empty stomach 1. 疝氣：八角茴香，小 茴香， 各9克，, 乳香 些少。水煎服。蓋被取汗。  2, 荔枝散 (證治准繩)：  主治:   疝氣﹐睾 丸腫 大，痛不可忍組成：荔 枝核（用新鮮者，燒炭存性）14 枚，八 角茴香（炒）、沉 香、木 香 、青鹽、食 鹽 各3g，川 楝子肉、小茴香各6g。上為細末。 用法：每服9g，空腹時熱酒調下。 Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Use with care in cases of yinxu (yin deficient)  with heat.  Sometimes the Chinese star anise (Illicium verum) is adulterated with Japanese star anise (Illicium anisatum L) which can be toxic and may have side effects for infants.  The side effects can include: signs of acute-onset irritability, jitteriness, clonus or myoclonus, increased deep tendon reflexes, nystagmus, vomiting, and seizures.[2]  It is not advisable to use star anise on infants.陰虛火 旺者慎服。有時八角茴香 (Illicium verum)之商品可能混有日本産的八角茴香而對婴兒可能産生急 性發作之煩躁不安，顫抖，抽筋或肌陣攣，增加深部肌腱反射，眼 球震顫，嘔吐和癲癇。不應用之於婴兒。　   Source: partially obtained from "Whole National Herb Edition� (in Chinese) 【摘錄】《全國中草藥匯編》  The following formulae will be translated on demand:【附方】  ①治小腸氣墜：八角茴香，小茴香各三錢，乳 香少許。水(煎)服取汗。(《仁齋直指方》)  ②治疝氣偏墜：八角茴香末一兩，小茴香末一兩。用豬尿胞一個，連尿入二末於內，系定罐內，以酒煮爛，連胞搗丸如梧子大。每服五十丸，白湯下。(《衛生雜興》 )  ③治腰重刺脹：八角茴香，炒，為末，食前酒服二錢。(《仁齋直指方》)  ④治腰痛如刺：八角茴香(炒研)每服二錢，食前鹽湯下。外以糯米一，二升，炒熱，袋盛，拴於痛處。(《簡便單方》)  ⑤治大小便皆秘，腹脹如鼓，氣促：大 麻子(炒，去殼)半兩，八角茴香七個。上作末，生蔥白三七個，同研煎湯，調五 苓散服。(《永類鈐方》)  ⑥治風毒濕氣，攻疰成瘡，皮肉紫破膿壞，行步無力，皮肉焮熱：八角茴香(炒)，地 龍 (去土，炒)，川 烏(炮，去皮尖)，烏 藥(銼)，牽牛子(炒)各一兩。 研杵勻細，酒煮糊為丸，如梧桐子大(如胡椒粒大小)。每服空心鹽湯下十五丸，日二。(《腳氣治法總要》茴香丸 )  註：疰 zh�: 有灌注和久住之意,多指具有傳染性和病程長的慢性病,主 要指勞瘵。如:疰忤(中醫病名 。猶中惡);疰夏(中醫學名詞。通常指夏季身倦、體熱、食少等症狀)[1] http://tw.18dao.net/%E9%A6%96%E9%A0%81[2] http://jama.ama-assn.org/cgi/content/full/291/5/562 Search this siteProblems with website? Name: tu fu ling
土茯苓
Biological: Smilax china L. (ba qi 菝葜)
Other name: cai yu yu liang 草禹餘糧

Geography: Yangtse River valley and all of the southern provinces of China
Maladies Treated: Joint pain due to dampness and heat
Turbid urine due to damp heat toxin
Acute or chronic inflammation of kidneys
Malignant sores with ulcerous swelling and toxin
Spasm and pain of sinews and bones
Unfavorable flexion and extension of joints
Hot stranguria with red, astringent and painful urine
Non-infection type of urinary tract syndrome
Medical Function: Clears heat, eliminates dampness, rids of toxin
Relieves itching
Unblocks channels and connections (通絡)

Inhibits aflatoxin B1-induced rat hepatoma development: feed containing tu fu ling extract (377.7g/kg) resulted in slightly fewer and significantly smaller r-GT-positive liver cell foci versus control group

Detoxification of gossypol: aqueous decoction, dilute ethanol extract, and crude flavonoids of tu fu ling (water decoction: per animal, daily dose 1g and 0.5g; dilute ethanol extract: dose of 1g and 2g raw herb equivalents; crude flavonoids: 50mg and 100mg; polysaccharide: 0.5ml and 1.0ml; ferrous sulfate: 8mg)—in animals given pure gossypol 650mg/kg, 850mg/kg, and 100mg/kg—demonstrated antagonistic effect against acute and subacute gossypol poisoning (P<0.05, P<0.001, and P<0.001 respectively)
Dilute ethanol extract of tu fu ling, when antagonizing gossypol toxicity, does not interfere with the spermatostatic effect of gossypol in male rats
Dosage:
For concoction: 15g to 30g per day.
For external use: make into powder.
Samples of Formulae:
Used for interstitial cystitis (間質性膀胱炎). 
Used for psoriasis (銀痟病).
Contraindications: Use caution in cases of gan shen yin xu (liver-kidney yin deficiency). Do not take with tea. During the medication period, avoid drinking tea.
Research:
Anti-tumor effect: In a study on the impact of chemical carcinogenesis in rat bladder, female Wistar rats (body weight 70-110g) received intragastric (ig) BBN (N-(4-hydroxybutyl) nitrosamine) in 36% ethanol solution—0.25ml (90mg) twice weekly for 12 weeks, total BBN dose per rat 2.16g. Tu fu ling group: BBN treatment as above with diet containing 120g tu fu ling dry powder per 1kg feed. At week 30, animals were sacrificed for histological analysis of bladder, ureter, renal pelvis, kidney, liver, and spleen. Results: tu fu ling group showed no significant inhibition of BBN-induced bladder tumors and a higher occurrence of squamous cell tumors. Conclusion: caution is advised when using tu fu ling for the prevention or treatment of bladder tumors.

Inhibition of aflatoxin B1 effect: In a rat hepatoma model, female Wistar rats (8 weeks old) were fed with tu fu ling-containing feed from 10 days before AFB1 injection to 3 days after. AFB1 (aflatoxin B1) was administered intraperitoneally (280ug/kg, 6 times/week x 2 weeks), followed by 2 weeks of feed containing 0.015% 2-acetyl aminofluorene (2AAF). Rats were sacrificed 10 days after surgical removal of liver lobes for r-glutamyl GGT (r-GT) staining. Results: r-GT-positive liver cell foci (pre-cancerous) were slightly fewer and markedly smaller in tu fu ling group (diet 377.7g/kg) compared to control. Conclusion: tu fu ling exhibits practical efficacy in prevention of liver cancer in this model.

Detoxification of gossypol: In male rats, aqueous decoction, dilute ethanol extract, crude flavonoids, and polysaccharide preparations of tu fu ling (each given for 3 days in various dosages), as well as ferrous sulfate, were tested for antagonism against pure gossypol administration (650mg/kg, 850mg/kg, and 100mg/kg). Results: Tu fu ling water decoction, dilute ethanol extract, and crude flavonoid preparations each antagonized both acute and subacute gossypol poisoning (statistical significance: P<0.05, P<0.001, and P<0.001). Ferrous sulfate, generally used for antagonizing gossypol poisoning, can affect its spermatostatic effects, but dilute ethanol extract of tu fu ling did not interfere with gossypol induced spermatostasis in male rats.
References: [1] 吴博； 馬躍平； 袁久志； 孫啟時； 【機構】 沈 陽藥科大學中藥學院
[1] WU Bo,MA Yue-ping,YUAN Jiu-zhi,SUN Qi-shi (School of Traditional Chinese Materia Medica,Shenyang Pharmaceutical University,Shenyang 110016,China)
[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草

Used in skin ulcer, joint pain due to dampness and heat, secondary problems in syphilis, rashes, turbid urine due to damp heat toxin, leptospirosis, acute dysentery, acute or chronic inflammation of kidneys, mercury toxin, psoriasis, and fungal infection.有清熱解毒﹐利 濕止 癢﹐ 通絡的功能。用於濕熱瘡毒﹐濕疹﹐惡瘡潰瀾腫毒﹐ 梅毒﹐筋骨拘攣疼痛﹐屈伸不利﹐熱淋尿赤澀痛等。可用於鉤 端螺旋體病﹐ 急性下痢﹐急慢性腎炎﹐汞中毒﹐銀 屑病, 黴菌感染。Medical Function:[2]药理：[2]1. anti-tumor effect:Anti-tumor effect1.1 impact of chemical carcinogenesis in the rat bladder.  Experiment animals： female Wistar rats, with 70-110g body weight.  Carcinogenic agents： NJ group an N-(4 - hydroxybutyl) nitrosamine (BBN), Experiment： 20% ethanol BBN dope formulated as a 36% solution.  Normal control group: In the ether under light anesthesia, purely using solvent (20% ethanol) 0.25 ml catheter ig, twice a week for a total of 12 wk.  Pathological group: 36% BBN solution 0.25ml (90 mg) ig, twice a week, a total of 12 wk, each rat the BBN total dose 2.16g. Tu fu ling: BBN treatment with pathological control group, diet for 1 kg 120g  tu fu ling dry powder. To wk 30 end of the experiment, the animals were sacrificed, bladder, ureter, renal pelvis, kidney, liver, and spleen for histological examination. The results: showed that the the  of tu fu ling group of BBN bladder tumors showed no significant inhibition, instead it occurred more squamous cell tumors. Conclusion:  be cautious in using tu fu ling in prevention and treatment of bladder tumor.  2. inhibit aflatoxin effect: preventing liver cancer1.2 effect of aflatoxin B1, on rat hepatoma Test animals: female Wistar rats, 8 week old Test: From 10 days before the AFB1injection to 3 days after ending the AFB1 injection, the rats were eating feed that contained the test animal feed. The hepatoma promoting dose: (ip) AFB1 (the 280 ug/kg, 6 / wkx2) for 2 weeks,  Tumor promotion program: feeding for 2 weeks with 0.015% 2 - acetyl aminofluorene (2AAF)  Then the liver lobes and left lateral lobes were removed at the end of one week.  After 10 days, the rats were sacrificed by neck breaking method. The liver were taken for r-glutamyl GGT (r-GT) staining.  Results: rat hepatic precancerous lesions with r-GT staining showed positive liver cell foci and slightly less in tu fu ling group (feed containing 377.7g/kg) lesions, and significantly less than the control group.  Conclusion: tu fu ling showed some practical value to prevent liver cancer.3. detoxification of gossypol1.抗腫瘤作用:1.1對大鼠膀胱化學致癌的影響:  實驗動物：雌 Wistar 大鼠，體重70-110g。 致癌劑：N-J基一N（4-羥丁基）亞硝胺（BBN）。 實驗：以20%乙醇將 BBN 原液配成36%的溶液。正常對照組：在乙醚淺麻醉下，單純以溶劑（20%乙醇）0.25ml經導管ig，每周2次，共12wk。 病理對照組：36%BBN溶液0.25ml（90mg）ig，每周2次，共12wk、 每隻鼠BBN總劑量2.16g。土茯苓組：BBN處理同病理對照組，以每1 kg含120g土茯苓乾粉的飲食飼養。 至wk30實驗結束，處死動物，取膀胱、輸尿管、腎盂，腎、肝和脾作組織學檢查。 結果：土茯苓組對BBN膀胱腫瘤的發生無明顯抑制作用，而且發生了較多的鱗狀細胞型腫瘤。 結論：因此在使用本品防治膀胱腫瘤時，應持慎重態度。  1.2對黃曲霉毒素B1致大鼠肝癌作用的影響  試驗動物：雌性 Wistar 大鼠，8wk齡， 試驗： 大鼠從注射AFB1前10d起，至停注AFB1後3d止，進食含受試物飼料。 肝癌啟動剤：(ip)AFB1（280ug/kg，6次/wkx2）。2 wk 後， 施以促癌程序：給含0.015% 2-乙酰氨基芴（2AAF）飼料2wk， 在 一周後，切除大鼠肝中葉和左外側葉。 10 d 後，斷頸處死大鼠，肝臟取材作 r-谷氨酰轉肽酶（r-GT）染色。 結果：大鼠肝癌前病變 r-GT染色陽性肝細胞灶。土茯苓組（飼料中含377.7g/kg）的病灶也稍少，且顯著小於對照組。  結論：提示土茯苓對預防肝癌有一定的實用價值。  2.對棉酚的解毒作用試驗動物：雄性大鼠採用土茯苓水煎劑（劑量：每鼠每日相當生藥1g和0.5g兩種），土茯苓稀醇制劑（劑量：相當生藥1g和2g），土茯苓粗黃酮（劑量：50mg和100mg），土茯苓多糖（劑量：0.5ml和1.0ml），硫酸亞鐵（劑量8mg），每組用藥3d後分別 igl 次純棉酚650mg/kg、850mg/kg和100mg/kg，觀察解毒作用。 結果：土茯苓水煎劑、稀醇制劑和粗黃酮均具有拮抗急性和亞急性棉酚中毒（P＜0.05，P＜0.001和P＜0.001）。一般棉酚中毒時可用硫酸亞鐵拮抗，但能影響抑精作用。土茯苓稀醇提取物在拮抗棉酚毒性的同時不影響棉酚對雄性大鼠的抑精作用。 編者按：ip 是 intraperitoneal
